contentfulPagePressRelease.title: Doha International Family Institute Calls for Papers for first Annual Conference on Family Research and Policy

childMarkdownRemark.html:
The Doha International Family Institute (DIFI) is holding its first annual conference on Family Research and Policy on 2-4 May 2015, in collaboration with the Social and Economic Survey Research Institute (SESRI) at Qatar University.



The annual conference is seeking to achieve the following objectives: focus on research, theory and practices that advance knowledge of the Arab family, highlight the role of the family as a defining force in shaping society, examine the role of policy in supporting the family and consider global issues which impact the Arab family. It will also engage with scholars and practitioners in discussions that analyze mutually beneficial practices within the context of family policy.

The Conference Organizing Committee is pleased to invite applicants to submit research paper proposals for this event. Applicants should be engaged in research on the Arab Region or any of its countries. Comparative papers are welcome, provided that their main focus is on the Arab region.

Proposals are welcome on the following subthemes:
  • Political, economic, and cultural challenges facing the Arab family in different regions of the Arab world.
  • Marriage and divorce in the Arab world; responses to challenges in terms of marriage practices (such as misyar, ‘urfi, mut’aa, mixed, marriage of minors, and living together-apart marriages); the causes and consequences of separation and divorce.
  • The role of state policies on family formation and stability, including the effect of the absence of such policies.
Proposals must be submitted electronically by 15 October 2014.

DIFI will present a Best Paper Award of $1,500 in each of the three specified sub-topics that constitute the conference
themes.

For more details about the Call for papers, Paper Guidelines and DIFI Copy Rights Agreement, please visit www.difi.org.qa.
